introduction.p: In this section of the text, we will explore the use of knowls.

subsection.title: Things that are automatically knowl-ized
subsection.p: Footnotes are even better as knowls.Because they appear adjacent to the footnote in the text when you click on them.
If we do a theorem that has a proof, the proof is automatically in a knowl. The theorem structure in MBX also has several key levels/components: theorem, title, index, statement, proof.

statement.p: If a triangle has sides of length a, b, and c, and a^2 + b^2 = c^2, then the triangle is a right triangle.

subsection.p: Examples are also automatically put into knowls.

example.p: Here is an example application of Theorem . Suppose that we have a triangle whose sides are of length 5, 12, 13. Then, since 5^2 + 12^2 = 25 + 144 = 169 = 13^2, it follows that the triangle must be a right triangle.
